page.title: 16ASHTON _ CONSERVATION 1
page.content: Near Ashton village there is a conservation area of about 5OO acres which is part of the land owned by the Ashton Wold Estate, the property of the Hon.Mrs Lane. The reserve is made up largely of woodland. There is also a lake and grassland. The woodland is a mixture of deciduous species, some of which date back to the original Domesday period. However, most of it was replanted in the mid- 1800's. Recently most of the elms were lost as a result of Dutch Elm disease in the 1970's. This century the bird population of the area has changed because of general changes in the habitat and surrounding farming methods. Recently over 1OO different species were recorded. Of particular interest were nightjars. nightingales and waxwings.
